GET /accounts/{account_id}/access/policy.description: Fetches the current status of a given Access policy test.

schema.description: The UUID of the policy test.

id.description: The UUID of the policy test.

pages_processed.description: The number of pages of (processed) users.

percent_approved.description: The percentage of (processed) users approved based on policy evaluation results.

percent_blocked.description: The percentage of (processed) users blocked based on policy evaluation results.

percent_users_processed.description: The percentage of users processed so far (of the entire user base).

status.description: The status of the policy test.

total_users.description: The total number of users in the user base.

users_approved.description: The number of (processed) users approved based on policy evaluation results.

users_blocked.description: The number of (processed) users blocked based on policy evaluation results.

200.description: Get an Access policy test update response.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

400.description: Get an Access policy test update response failure.

GET /accounts/{account_id}/access/policy.summary: Get the current status of a given Access policy test

GET /accounts/{account_id}/access/policy.description: Fetches a single page of user results from an Access policy test.

schema.description: The UUID of the policy test.

status.description: Policy evaluation result for an individual user.

200.description: Get an Access policy tester users page response.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

400.description: Get an Access policy tester users page response failure.

GET /accounts/{account_id}/access/policy.summary: Get an Access policy test users page

approval_groups.description: Administrators who can approve a temporary authentication request.

items.description: A group of email addresses that can approve a temporary authentication request.

approvals_needed.description: The number of approvals needed to obtain access.

email_addresses.description: A list of emails that can approve the access request.

email_list_uuid.description: The UUID of an re-usable email list.

approval_required.description: Requires the user to request access from an administrator at the start of each session.

connection_rules.description: The rules that define how users may connect to the targets secured by your application.

ssh.description: The SSH-specific rules that define how users may connect to the targets secured by your application.

usernames.description: Contains the Unix usernames that may be used when connecting over SSH.

ssh.title: SSH Connection Rules

connection_rules.title: Connection Rules

decision.description: The action Access will take if a user matches this policy.

exclude.description: Rules evaluated with a NOT logical operator. To match the policy, a user cannot meet any of the Exclude rules.

isolation_required.description: Require this application to be served in an isolated browser for users matching this policy. 'Client Web Isolation' must be on for the account in order to use this feature.

name.description: The name of the Access policy.

purpose_justification_prompt.description: A custom message that will appear on the purpose justification screen.
purpose_justification_prompt.example: Please enter a justification for entering this protected domain.

purpose_justification_required.description: Require users to enter a justification when they log in to the application.

require.description: Rules evaluated with an AND logical operator. To match the policy, a user must meet all of the Require rules.

session_duration.description: The amount of time that tokens issued for the application will be valid. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or s), ms, s, m, h.
